name: What Your Mouth Is Whispering
description:
"What Your Mouth Is Whispering" was developed in the evening sessions of a 3-Day seminar on Walking Simulators and the concept of the "flaneur" at the Cologne Game Lab. 

Short description cited from the syllabus:

The 3-day seminar "Poetry, Philosophy, Psychedelic Drugs, and Walking Simulators" "[...] brings together presentations and discussions, along with an extended game jam to explore the phenomenon of liminal control in games, perhaps best represented by the rise of the walking simulator."

This game was inspired by the subway scene in Wim Wenders 1987 film "Der Himmel über Berlin" (Engl.:  Wings of Desire): 

The game was created by: 

Alexandra Petrus: Level Design & Art Direction (all assets from the Unity Asset Store)
Curtis Maughan: Writing
Alex Boccia: Sound Design
Rüdiger Brandis: Programming
